interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: Flight of the Navigator
Review Date: 2015/11/22
Store: Joey Cramer  (Actor),     Veronica Cartwright  (Actor),     Randal Kleiser  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    PG    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Science Fiction & Fantasy, Fantasy
Product Description: ['Product Description', 'David Freeman (Joey Cramer) is an ordinary boy destined for a most extraordinary adventure -- aboard a spectacular, futuristic spacecraft. After a mystifying disappearance, David returns, possessing vast, undiscovered knowledge about the farthest reaches of the universe. With these sudden navigational powers, David is able to take the fantastic flying machine anywhere he desires, accompanied by both its wisecracking robotic commander, Max, and an assortment of bizarre extraterrestrial creatures! Embark on a fun-filled, fast-paced journey of fantasy and adventure as David takes off on the flight of a lifetime! Also featuring Sarah Jessica Parker and the voice of Paul Reubens.|The movie was filmed in Broward County, Florida, and, at the other extreme, Norway.|Sarah Jessica Parker makes one of her first film appearances in this 1986 flick.|Paul Reubens (Pee-wee Herman) stars as the voice of Max, a wisecracking robotic spaceship commander.', 'Amazon.com', "Disney's 1986", 'Flight of the Navigator', "combines a strong ensemble cast and classic '80s soundtrack with dazzling special effects for a high-flying sci-fi adventure. While searching for his little brother in the woods, 12-year-old David Freeman (Joey Cramer) falls down a ravine and is knocked unconscious. After what seems like minutes, he returns home, only to discover that eight years have passed since he was declared missing and presumed dead. Even more mystifying is that David hasn't aged, nor can he account for the time lapse. Meanwhile, NASA officials stumble upon a futuristic spacecraft and are determined to assess what David knows about it by locking him in a top-secret lab for scanning and testing. His only chance of escape is in the spacecraft manned by Max, a wisecracking robot. Cramer gives an earnest performance, which overcomes an imperfect script, while enough one-liners and imaginative animation will keep families engaged. Watch for Sarah Jessica Parker in one of her first film appearances. Rated PG for language. (Ages 6 and older)", '--Lynn Gibson']
Average Rating: 4.8
Product Details: {'Genre': 'ACTION, Action/Adventure, LIVE', 'Format': 'Color, NTSC, Subtitled, Surround Sound, Widescreen', 'Contributor': 'Richard Liberty, Sarah Jessica Parker, Brigid Cleary, Michael Burton, Cliff De Young, Paul Reubens, Veronica Cartwright, Ted Bartsch, Michael Strano, Cynthia Caquelin, Raymond Forchion, Gizelle Elliot, Robert Small, Matt Adler, Jonathan Sanger, Matt MacManus, Howard Hesseman, Albie Whitaker, Iris Acker, Randal Kleiser, Joey CramerRichard Liberty, Sarah Jessica Parker, Brigid Cleary, Michael Burton, Cliff De Young, Paul Reubens, Veronica Cartwright, Ted Bartsch, Michael Strano, Cynthia Caquelin, Raymond Forchion, Gizelle Elliot, Robert Small, Matt Adler, Jonathan Sanger, Matt MacManus, Howar…  See more', 'Language': 'Unqualified, English (Dolby Surround)', 'Runtime': '1 hour and 30 minutes', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.85:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG (Parental Guidance Suggested)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.6 x 5.5 x 7.5 inches; 2.4 Ounces', 'Item model number': '2259724', 'Director': 'Randal Kleiser', 'Media Format': 'Color, NTSC, Subtitled, Surround Sound, Widescreen', 'Run time': '1 hour and 30 minutes', 'Release date': 'June 1, 2004', 'Actors': 'Joey Cramer, Veronica Cartwright, Cliff De Young, Sarah Jessica Parker, Matt Adler', 'Subtitles': 'French, Spanish', 'Studio': 'WALT DISNEY PICTURES', 'Writers': 'Michael Burton, Matt MacManus', 'Country of Origin': 'USA', 'Number of discs': '1'}
Review Text: Super movie.  Kids and adults loved it (again).  Great music (lots of beach boys tunes) will have the viewers of all ages toe tapping and dancing about.
Review Title: Super movie.  Kids and adults loved it
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------
reference_summary:
Defying Gravity: Season 1 Livingston, Ron (Actor), Airlie, Andrew (Actor) Rated: Unrated Format: DVD Movies & TV, Studio Specials, 20th Century Fox Home Entertainment, Fox TV, General ['Set in the very near future, eight astronauts from five countries undertake a mysterious six-year international mission on the spaceship Antares. This sexy and provocative sci fi thriller follows 4 men and 4 women through the solar system where their pasts reveal intimate and interconnected secrets that have a strange effect on the present and mysteries yet to be revealed. DVD includes 5 episodes never seen on television.'] {'Format': 'AC-3, Box set, Multiple Formats, Color, Dolby, NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Contributor': 'Yoba, Malik, Airlie, Andrew, Livingston, Ron', 'Language': 'Unqualified', 'Runtime': '9 hours and 20 minutes', 'Studio': '20th Century Fox', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.78:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'Unrated (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 6.4 Ounces', 'Item model number': '109899521990', 'Media Format': 'AC-3, Box set, Multiple Formats, Color, Dolby, NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Run time': '9 hours and 20 minutes', 'Release date': 'January 19, 2010', 'Actors': 'Livingston, Ron, Airlie, Andrew, Yoba, Malik', 'Subtitles': 'English, French, Spanish', 'Number of discs': '4'} Good series, better on DVD w/o dumb commercials to interrupt.

Want show brought back!! Good series, better on DVD The Sound of Music Live! Carrie Underwood (Actor), Stephen Moyer (Actor), Beth McCarthy-Miller (Director), Rob Ashford (Director) & 1 more Rated: NR Format: DVD Movies & TV, Award Winners in Movies & TV, Emmy Central, Emmy Nominees ["An aspiring nun in pre-WWII Austria leaves the abbey to become a governess for the widower Captain von Trapp's seven children and finds herself falling in love. Beloved worldwide, The Sound of Music includes unforgettable songs including “Edelweiss”, “Do-Re-Mi,” “My Favorite Things,” and “The Sound of Music”."] {'Aspect Ratio': '1.78:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'NR (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 2.72 Ounces', 'Item model number': '274264', 'Director': 'Beth McCarthy-Miller, Rob Ashford', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Color, NTSC, Widescreen', 'Run time': '2 hours and 15 minutes', 'Release date': 'December 17, 2013', 'Actors': 'Carrie Underwood, Stephen Moyer, Laura Benanti, Christian Borle, Audra McDonald', 'Producers': 'Priscilla Taussig', 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 5.1)', 'Studio': 'Universal Pictures Home Entertainment', 'Number of discs': '1'} There is a good reason why the original 1959 broadway version is basically lost to time and unknown while the movie version that followed is known to nearly everyone and widely beloved. The movie version rocks and the broadway version in comparision suxs.

Thus having painfully sat through this remake of the broadway version I will rate it a tedious and un-interesting if not embarrassing. Additionally the audio mix in the new one is terrible (or the lead has a very weak voice) and the stage is poor.

Overall nothing in this new version sparkles...I would rate it lower that a typical high school drama club presentation of Fiddler on the Roof...except here I no children I am related to to compele me to attend. And I am sorry I did. Poor at best... {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]', 'हिन्दी', 'मराठी', 'తెలుగు', 'Français', 'தமிழ்'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]', 'Français', 'हिन्दी', 'Indonesia', '한국어', 'Bahasa Melayu', 'ไทย', 'Tiếng Việt', '中文（简体）'], 'Directors': ['Gary Ross'], 'Producers': ['Nina Jacobson', 'Jon Kilik'], 'Starring': ['Jennifer Lawrence', 'Josh Hutcherson', 'Liam Hemsworth'], 'Studio': ['SciFi and Fantasy']} I have to guess that I missed something.

Despite all the hype over this, I was just underwhelmed.

A very small story told even smaller. Very ordinary movie? {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'substance use', 'alcohol use', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Charles Beeson', 'Jeffrey G. Hunt', 'David Nutter', 'J. Miller Tobin', 'Bryan Spicer', 'Guy Norman Bee', 'Jeff Woolnough', 'Matt Earl Beesley', 'Milan Cheylov', 'Holly Dale'], 'Studio': ['FOX']} TSCC is one of the best of TV and best of Sci-Fi genre. Highly recommend it.

Bummer that it was terminated after 2 seasons, but the writers did end it pretty well. I would love a few more seasons for sure.. I would give it 10 Stars {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Chip Chalmers', 'Cliff Bole', 'David Carson', 'Gabrielle Beaumont', 'Michael Wagner', 'Jonathan Frakes', 'Les Landau', 'Robert Legato', 'Robert Scheerer', 'Robert Wiemer', 'Shari Goodhart', 'Timothy Bond', 'Tom Benko', 'Winrich Kolbe'], 'Producers': ['Rick Berman', 'Michael Piller', 'Jeri Taylor'], 'Starring': ['Patrick Stewart', 'Jonathan Frakes', 'Levar Burton'], 'Studio': ['CBS']} A good season. Nothing to really complain about. A good season. Interstellar (Blu-ray + DVD Combo Pack) Nolan, Christopher (Director), McConaughey, Matthew (Actor), Hathaway, Anne (Actor) & 0 more Rated: PG-13 Format: Blu-ray Movies & TV, Award Winners in Movies & TV, Oscar Central, Past Oscar Winners ['With our time on Earth coming to an end, a team of explorers undertakes the most important mission in human history; traveling beyond this galaxy to discover whether mankind has a future among the stars.'] {'Genre': 'Drama', 'Format': 'Blu-ray, Color, DTS Surround Sound, Digital_copy, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Contributor': 'Burstyn, Ellen, McConaughey, Matthew, Affleck, Casey, Caine, Michael, Lithgow, John, Gyasi, David, Nolan, Christopher, Foy, MacKenzie, Hathaway, Anne, Chastain, JessicaBurstyn, Ellen, McConaughey, Matthew, Affleck, Casey, Caine, Michael, Lithgow, John, Gyasi, David, Nolan, Christopher, Foy, MacKenzie, Hathaway, Anne, Chastain, Jessica See more', 'Language': 'English', 'Runtime': '2 hours and 48 minutes', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG-13 (Parents Strongly Cautioned)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 0.32 Ounces', 'Item model number': '59165890000', 'Director': 'Nolan, Christopher', 'Media Format': 'Blu-ray, Color, DTS Surround Sound, Digital_copy, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Run time': '2 hours and 48 minutes', 'Release date': 'March 31, 2015', 'Actors': 'McConaughey, Matthew, Hathaway, Anne, Caine, Michael, Chastain, Jessica, Affleck, Casey', 'Subtitles': 'English, French, Spanish', 'Studio': 'Warner Home Video', 'Number of discs': '2'} Pretty meager as a full length feature movie. With editing it would pass muster as a ''Made for TV'' movie. Mathew is always compelling as an actor and worth a couple of tickets just to see his work. Pretty meager as a full length feature movie Focus (Blu-ray ) Will Smith (Actor), Margot Robbie (Actor) Rated: R Format: Blu-ray Movies & TV, Featured Categories, Blu-ray, Comedy ['Focus (Blu-ray)', 'Will Smith stars as Nicky, a seasoned master of misdirection who becomes romantically involved with novice con artist Jess (Margot Robbie) as he’s teaching her the tricks of the trade.', ']]>'] {'Genre': 'Comedy', 'Format': 'Blu-ray', 'Contributor': 'Denise Di Novi, Glenn Ficarra, Charlie Gogolak, Will Smith, Robert Taylor, Rodrigo Santoro, B.D. Wong, Gerald McRaney, John Requa, Margot Robbie, Stan Wlodkowski, Adrian MartinezDenise Di Novi, Glenn Ficarra, Charlie Gogolak, Will Smith, Robert Taylor, Rodrigo Santoro, B.D. Wong, Gerald McRaney, John Requa, Margot Robbie, Stan Wlodkowski, Adrian Martinez See more', 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 5.1), Spanish (Dolby Digital 5.1), English (DTS 5.1)', 'Runtime': '1 hour and 44 minutes', 'Digital Copy Expiration Date': 'June 2, 2018', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'R (Restricted)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.6 x 5.4 x 6.7 inches; 3.2 Ounces', 'Item model number': '34050049', 'Director': 'John Requa, Glenn Ficarra', 'Media Format': 'Blu-ray', 'Run time': '1 hour and 44 minutes', 'Release date': 'June 2, 2015', 'Actors': 'Will Smith, Margot Robbie, Rodrigo Santoro, Gerald McRaney, Adrian Martinez', 'Subtitles': 'French, Portuguese, Spanish', 'Producers': 'Denise Di Novi, Charlie Gogolak, Stan Wlodkowski', 'Studio': 'WarnerBrothers', 'Writers': 'John Requa, Glenn Ficarra', 'Number of discs': '1'} Great movie. But the action is fast and discreet so save movie until you are ready to really watch it closely. Both lead actors put in exceptional performances to say the least. Be sure to keep an eye on the gruffy old bouncer too. BTW; Ms Robbie is very pleasant visually and was surprisingly effective in this role (would not have minded seeing a lot more of her...;) Great Movie -- a must see Flight of the Navigator Joey Cramer (Actor), Veronica Cartwright (Actor), Randal Kleiser (Director) & 0 more Rated: PG Format: DVD Movies & TV, Science Fiction & Fantasy, Fantasy ['Product Description', 'David Freeman (Joey Cramer) is an ordinary boy destined for a most extraordinary adventure -- aboard a spectacular, futuristic spacecraft. profile:
**Updated User Profile Summary:**

The user exhibits a strong investment in sci-fi and character-driven narratives, particularly valuing complex interpersonal dynamics. Their recent critical review of a previously acclaimed film highlights a discerning approach, showcasing disappointment despite acknowledging the lead actor’s performance. This indicates their commitment to high-quality storytelling and thematic depth.

However, the user also embraces a balance in their taste, as evidenced by their enthusiasm for a classic film that captivates both kids and adults, complemented by an engaging soundtrack. This reflects their appreciation for lighter fare alongside serious drama, indicating versatility in entertainment preferences.

Nostalgia plays a significant role in the user's viewing habits, prompting rigorous comparisons with new works as they seek emotionally resonant content that meets their high expectations for quality. Their preference for immersive viewing experiences continues, with a strong inclination towards DVD formats.

Overall, the user is a discerning viewer dedicated to authentic media consumption. Their critical engagement with contemporary works, paired with enthusiastic reviews of nostalgic favorites, underscores a commitment to storytelling that resonates on multiple levels while maintaining a passion for both adventure and lighthearted enjoyment.
